item.title: SLIP-P - Shamir DEK Visualization on Plates TineySeed / OneKey KeyTag - style
item.description:
SLIP-P is a Python tool that allows visualizing Shamir-split DEKs on plates in a Tinyseed / OneKey KeyTag - style layout. It supports 128, 192, and 256-bit DEKs with dynamic checksum.

The idea started from traditional mnemonic splitting but was optimized to fit binary shares on physical plates for secure offline storage. Each DEK can be split into multiple shares and any threshold of shares can be used to recover the original DEK.

item.title: Adding Nostr Login to My Rails Application
item.description: In this blog post, I will walk you through the process of integrating Nostr login functionality into my Rails application using the Nos2x extension. This involved modifying the Devise User model, adding a new route to handle Nostr users, and integrating JavaScript to enhance the login experience.

item.title: Enhancing "In Archives" Rails Applications Search Functionality
item.description: In web development, an efficient and user-friendly search function is essential for a good user experience. While working on the “In Archives” project, I initially cached the dataset without pagination, which led to poor performance—eight times worse than expected—because pagination was applied to the entire cached dataset.
